user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_uname_type:
```c
_MHD_static_inline enum MHD_DigestAuthUsernameType
get_rq_uname_type (const struct MHD_RqDAuth *params)
{
  if (NULL != params->username.value.str)
  {
    if (NULL == params->username_ext.value.str)
      return params->userhash ?
             MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH :
             MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD;
    else  /* Both 'username' and 'username*' are used */
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_INVALID;
  }
  else if (NULL != params->username_ext.value.str)
  {
    if (! params->username_ext.quoted && ! params->userhash &&
        (MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_MIN_LEN <= params->username_ext.value.len) )
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_EXTENDED;
    else
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_INVALID;
  }

  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_MISSING;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No other language/compiler-specific extension syntax is present in the function body. The code uses only standard C constructs: pointer dereferences and NULL comparisons, if/else control flow, the conditional (?:) operator, enum return values, integer/boolean expressions, and comments. There are no uses of commonly documented compiler extensions such as __attribute__, __asm__, __inline__ (explicit), typeof, _Alignas/_Alignof, _Noreturn, or other compiler-specific keywords or built-ins. Identifier naming (underscores) is not by itself a language extension. Therefore only the function declaration line that uses the macro-like token _MHD_static_inline needs investigation (to see how that macro expands and whether it introduces compiler-specific extensions); the remainder does not require investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
